page.title: 05THE CHURCH IN KEMPSEY.
page.content: This nicely situated building was founded in 868 by Bishop Aelhun (848-872) who dedicated it to St.Andrew. During William I's Domesday Survey in 1086, a "priest in Kempsey" was recorded so it is a fair assumption that either a small church or chapel was present for the count. Since the start of the church history, sixty six vicars have taken their position as leading members of the church. The present vicar, Reverend Toogood, has recently held a festival of talents in the church nave with talents ranging from modelling to italic writing. In 1984 he also contributed to a book on the Kempsey parish and the surrounding area. This book was both printed and published by the people of Kempsey themselves and was put on sale in the surrounding area.
